title: What does Hinkley mean for you?
text:
An artist's impression of the how the new Hinkley Point C station will look Credit: PA Somerset has been gearing up for Hinkley for years but now the project has got the final go ahead, business leaders say there should be a jobs bonanza.
As David Cameron secures the financial might of China over the next few days, the construction of Britain's first nuclear power plant for a generation, is within touching distance.
The plant is expected to supply 7% of the UK's electricity needs, powering around six million homes, and creating thousands of jobs. But what will it mean for the south west? And how can you directly benefit?
The politicians getting an overview of the construction of Hinkley Credit: PA 'Jobs', 'employment', 'hard-working families' - these are the buzzwords on the tips of our politicians tongues when talking about Hinkley. While it may be repetitive, they do make a strong case:
The construction of Hinkley Point C is estimated to create 25,000 jobs. The project also aims to create 1,000 apprenticeships, and that's before it's even fully completed in 2025.
For how to apply for jobs, the recruitment process is already underway via EDF - http://www.edfenergy.com/energy/nuclear-new-build-projects/hinkley-point-c/jobs
Elecsis Switchgear is expecting to double their workforce Credit: ITV News One company in Bridgwater, that's already benefiting, is Elecsis Switchgear Ltd. They build switchboards to transfer power, and now, with the prospect of supplying Hinkley, they're constructing a new factory and taking on more engineers.
"We actually have an expansion programme at Elecsis switchgear where we are not only looking to double the size of our manufacturing facility but at least double the amount of employees that we have".
– CHRIS PRATT MD, Elecsis Switchgear Ltd William Haley is hoping to benefit from having Hinkley on its doorstep Credit: ITV News Down the road in the shadow of Brent Knoll, an unexpected sight off a country lane. A vast arena of blue light and sparks. William Haley Engineering makes the steel frames for buildings. They are hoping to win some contracts at Hinkley and swell the ranks of their 55 strong workforce.
"It's a very big opportunity and it is exciting and it means we can expand and come up with new products and ideas and it is quite a long project so we've got plenty of time to do that and we're looking forward to having one on our doorstep which makes a change from working all around the country."
– WILL HALEY Director, The Haley Group Opportunities are already emerging across the south west, but with further investment to be confirmed, this is just the beginning. Hinkley will have a lasting impact on employment across our region, and now is the time to take advantage.
